results.headline: Madeline (Movie)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Madeline

results.summary_short: The 12 little girls from Ludwig Bemelmans's "Madeline" stories are still in straight lines, but for the screen they've been taught to lisp. A picture-book prettiness pervades this too terribly sweet tale drawn from four Bemelmans books. Frances McDormand contributes her usually adept performance as Miss Clavel, and a production team not known for treacle has given the film a spare visual sophistication. Otherwise it is best watched by viewers who approach the material in a state of pre-adoration.
